description: From Middle English childberyng, childbering, chyldberynge, child berynge, equivalent to child +â€Ž bearing.

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, or suitable for childbirth
examples: Women in the latter stages of childbearing should not be permitted to attend the toll of the manufactories.

entries.meaning: The process of giving birth; pregnancy and parturition
examples: From the Swedish returns (1776-1855) it appears that 100 childbearings produced 101.62 children, viz., 2.82 stillborn, 98.80 quickborn; consequently 100 quickborn children imply 101.21 childbearings.
